oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A PRACTICE APPLICABLE MODEL FOR THE ASSESSMENT OF MANAGEMENT IMPACT ON ORGANIC MATTER IN ARABLE SOILS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Brock, Christopher
Leithold, G端nter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
Crop husbandry
Environmental aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present the HU-MOD-2 model for the assessment of management impact on organic matter levels in arable soils. The model aims at optimal applicability as a management support tool in framing practice and therefore requires only easily available input data. In validation, the tool proved to be capable of giving a rough estimate on soil organic matter changes in arable soils. Taking into account the low demand for input data, the modeling error seems tolerable for a practice applicable decision support tool.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Brock, Christopher and Leithold, G端nter (2014) A PRACTICE APPLICABLE MODEL FOR THE ASSESSMENT OF MANAGEMENT IMPACT ON ORGANIC MATTER IN ARABLE SOILS. In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Th端nen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 2, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 457-458.
